about_the_game:
The Unwanted War is a real-time strategy game (RTS) set throughout human history. The game lets you play skirmishes in singleplayer, multiplayer and a campaign on battlefields located across the globe. Each playable era has fitting factions with their own units, buildings and research.

Collect resources, construct a base, train units and defeat your enemies with overwhelming force, research and skill!

The Unwanted War lets you fight through the ages:


  • Experience the history of war in Ancient times.
  • Conquer with the vikings in the Norse era.
  • Live through the dark times of the Middle Ages.
  • Explore the battlefields of the Napoleonic Wars.
  • Survive in the deserts of the Wild West.
  • Fight in the giant battles of World War 1.
  • Command combined arms in World War 2.
  • See how war has changed in the Contemporary time.

Singleplayer

Fight in skirmishes with up to 7 computer players on battlefields from humans history of war. Explore the maps, learn the lay of the land and use your tactical prowess to win every battle! Command armies from factions with unique perks and abilities and outmaneuver your opponents.

Multiplayer

Have up to 7 other players join you in the fight. Who will be victorious? Form teams to explore joint strategies and support each other as allies!

Campaign

Experience a campaign throughout human history and do your best to win every battle. Will you be the one to save humanity in the end or will you bring devastation over the entire planet?

content_descriptors.notes: As this games focus is the history of war in human history, most of the content deals with this. There are battles and actions in this that resemble acts of war. The models and animations remain stylized, though the audio can be more detailed.

  • Processor: AMD FX-8350
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Radeon RX 570
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 20 GB available space

short_description: Fight battles through human history, defeat your enemies and save humanities future! The Unwanted War lets you follow history itself and take influence on humanities ultimate fate. Are you going to use your knowledge and power for good or will you bring doom over the human race?
